page.title: Category:Help
page.text:
This category is intended to contain all the "help" pages for this Wikia: pages that can help contributors and/or readers. Most, but not all, have "Help:" at the beginning of their page names and are therefore in the "Help" namespace; an automatically-generated list of those can be found at [[Special:Allpages]] by running down the "Namespace" menu. Many wikis also make much use of a [[Help:Contents]] page, where headings and tables may be used to cover the main areas, in contrast to a [[Special:Categories|category]], which is fairly rigidly based on alphabetical order.
If you find helpful pages that you think should be here, you may include them here just by typing [[category:help]] on them.
You can also: * ask questions on discussions * talk to one of the [[Special:Listadmins|site administrators]] or any currently active contributor (the people whose names appear on [[Special:Recentchanges|the "Recent changes" page]]); use their User Talk pages.
If you can't find what you need on this wiki, you can seek help at the [[Wikia:Wikia|Central Wikia]]. There are more help pages at [[Wikia:Category:Help]].
If you still need help, you may want to contact the [[Wikia:Community Team|Wikia Community Team]].
[[cs:Category:Nápověda]] [[de:Category:Hilfe]] [[Category:Witcher Wiki]]

[[File:Substances_Big_Special.png|right|Special Ingredients]]

page.title: Category:Draconids
page.text: {{Block Quote|text = The very mention of a dragon is enough to send a shiver of fear even among experienced witchers. True dragons, however, are seen rarely these days, driven off by wars or slain by the mass-hunts of the past. It does not stop villagers from claiming that every small draconid they see is a dragon. This does not mean that basilisks or forktails are less threatening to human lives, there is good reason why contracts for their heads are written, and why witchers are sought to claim them.|citation = Prima Guide}}[[pl:Kategoria:Drakonidy]] [[ru:Категория:Дракониды]] [[uk:Категорія:Драконіди]] [[Category:Creatures]]

'''Dragons''' were winged reptiles with incredible intelect and magical powers. They were divided to [[Red dragon|red]], [[Green dragon|green]], [[White dragon|white]], [[Black dragon|black]], [[Rock dragon|rock]] and [[Golden dragon|golden]]. They were part of [[Draconid]] family.

page.title: Category:Vassal states
page.text: A vassal state is a territory (usually a country/state) ruled over by a vassal who is a subordinate of another state. Vassal states typically supply military power to the dominant state and some pay tributes. They differ from protectorate states in the sense the latter usually enter such an agreement willingly and the dominant state provides military power in exchange for other interests. [[Category:Locations]]

page.title: Category:City-states
page.text: A city-state is considered a small, sovereign state that usually just encompasses a city and its territories. [[Category:Locations]]

page.title: Category:Coats of arms - cities
page.text: For some cities (particularly city-states) that have their own COA. [[Category:Coats of arms]]

page.title: Category:The Witcher food and drinks
page.text: [[Category:The Witcher items|Food and drinks]] For food and drinks in {{Tw1}}. [[Category:Food and drink]]

page.title: Category:Baronies
page.text: Baronies are small regions ruled over by a Baron/Baroness and generally part of another country. [[Category:Locations]]

page.title: Category:Counties
page.text:
'''Counties''' are usually medium sized regions ruled over by an Earl/Count or Countess and usually part of a country.
[[pl:Kategoria:Hrabstwa]] [[Category:Locations]]

page.title: Category:Duchies
page.text:
'''Duchies''' are usually large regions ruled over by a Duke or Duchess and generally part of a country. However, even if one holds such a title it doesn't necessarily make the land a duchy. For instance, some princedoms are ruled over by dukes/duchesses but kept the title of princedom in the land's name.
[[Category:Locations]]
[[ar:تصنيف:دوقيات]] [[ru:Категория:Герцогства]] [[uk:Категорія:Герцогства]]

page.title: Category:Article Management templates
page.text:
[[Category:Templates]] This contains templates that are generally to help mark off pages in some manner for viewer or editor purposes.
Important: note that for mobile, assigning a template as "notice" means it won't appear for mobile skin. For now, all typical notice templates have been re-assigned to "Design" so it'll appear for those reading on the mobile version of the site. Do not alter these to "notice" until this bug is considered resolved, thanks!

page.title: Category:Replace
page.text: This is a category of images that could be better quality and should be replaced when possible. Add images to this category if it meets any of the following: * is blurry * too small (making it hard to see what's actually in the image) * not a good representation of subject (like it's of a location but 50% of the photo is just of Geralt's back) * has subtitles (subtitles should only be shown if it's crucial to make a point, like showing a bug) * shows any interface (like the above, UI should be hidden unless crucial) * file size itself is too large (most images should be kept below 1.5 MB unless it's concept art or a major subject) [[Category:Site Maintenance]]

page.text:
[[The Witcher Thursdays]] is a series of freebies for {{TWRPG}} shared weekly on the game's official Polish fanpage. It is not authorized by R. Talsorian Games nor the Polish publisher, thus making it unofficial in [[CD PROJEKT RED's The Witcher franchise|CD PROJEKT RED's continuity]].
[[Category:The Witcher Role-Playing Game]]
